reviews.review_msg: He is such a nice person who genuinely cares; however, his class can be extremely boring at times as he rambles about irrelevant topics causing us to be behind in modules leading up to exams. Exams are easy if you remember every single term in each module (20 terms a module x7 for each exam 140 terms). Dmap assignment is awesome! paper is okay.

I took educ 220 as an online class and GPA booster. It's a lot harder than I thought! Weekly quizzes, bi-weekly online group discussions that you have to post in 3 times a week for a passing grade, and lots of written work plus a final paper. My TA Daniel was great and super helpful. Midterm and final exams were also very hard. So study up!

Get ready to memorize the textbook from cover to cover. Quizzes and practice exam are nothing like the actual thing. TA (Mladen) specified this and also gave us the wrong chapter on the practice exam (one that we didn't cover and was not on the final). Unresponsive to his online office in Canvas. This class was harder than it needed to be.

John is a fine professor, lectures are a little slow but everything is posted online. Honestly didn't attend more than 4 lectures and never once went to the tutorial and I'm still getting over 90% in the course. Study the slides and the textbook, DEFINITELY do the quizzes and you'll do fine.
Midterm was not as hard as people claim it is.  Lectures are very closely related to the textbook..  DEFINITELY read the textbook.... Awesome TAs Very interesting material

I took the online EDUC 220 and it was more challenging and unpleasant than it needed to be. The exams cover way too much material (7 chapters each) and the questions are too detailed and specific; providing choices on topics would have been better.  The online portion (discussions) are also very tedious and not engaging as they were meant to be.
John's lectures are awesome! He's a great prof and make the material interesting. He's a fair grader, but his exams are somewhat difficult. DEFINITELY read the textbook!!!

Dr. Nesbit is a very boring professor, and not very good at teaching. He is extremely monotone, and hard to follow. The TA's are what make this an interesting course. The exams are somewhat hard, and one needs to memorize some sections of the textbook.
I took his course in Fall 2013. He is my favorite prof but I don't like my TA i think she is a tough marker. Remember just focus on the textbook and some of the lecture note and you'll survive.

The TM was the person the class kept in contact for Educ 220 ONLINE. There's discussions, a paper, and 2 exams. You must put in the effort and make sure to thoroughly read study guide and textbook for exams.

Provides quizzes which cover only 1/4 of the exam material. Tested material is found throughout the entirety of the textbook & has to be read word-for-word to perform well. He relies on his own data analyses of tests/scores heavily, which felt like an archaic teaching approach. Very mechanical running the class, did provide bonus marks though.
If you're going to take this class, take it with a different prof or online.. Content is fairly interesting and easy, but the prof makes it painfully boring and excessively difficult.
My favorite prof at SFU!

I loved him as a person and think he's awesome and super knowledgeable but he tends to ramble on and on. The only real complaint I have is that his exams aren't really based on what he talks about... sometimes he rips things from the textbook (which is very extensive) that are so specific it's impossible to study for.
SO GOOD. He might just be one of my favs. Material is somewhat dry so it is hard to keep the lecture interesting, but he used visual aids and humour to keep me awake. Highly recommended.

content is quite interesting and the professor livens up his lectures by occasionally using autotune videos and a few humorous examples. there is lots of reading, so this course is great for those who are good at memorizing lots of facts. exams are completely MC  so it is very difficult to get a bad grade in this course.

I can't believe people think this class is boring! I think the prof does such a good job explaining the concepts and you can see his passion. Yes, you do have to read a lot to get a good grade, but the exams are fair if you keep up. I would recommend this class with this prof if you're alright with reading
Might have to do a lots of readings, but he is a Great Prof who really put efforts on understanding his students!!

wow... sat in this class thinking of ways I could gouge out my own eyeballs. most boring class I have ever taken in my life. exams are m/c but so random. papers are easy, ta Elisa super helpful. Took this class because I thought it would be a gpa booster.... definitely not!
He is a pretty good professor. In comparison he may not be god tier, but he is good enough. He smiles when he teaches and does a good job. He also knows things, but yeah. I enjoyed it.

Very clear explanations and examples during his lectures. His slides are all available to be printed out, and in addition, his lectures are all recorded. However, given his style is to lecture for the full hour, it can get boring. Textbook is quite a lot to read: straightforward format 1 chapter per week.

So boring. The textbook is more interesting and is all the tests are based out of. You are not required to go to tutorial/lecture. Super easy tests and papers. 3 multiple choice exams and 2 papers (4-8pages) Easy A.

Lectures could get a little boring and he spent a lot of time on one subject. He loves concept maps. The exams were easy, all multiple choice and if you read the lecture notes and the textbook, exams were easy. Assignments were okay too, large topic ranges. Overall, he was a little boring, the the class was interesting and worth taking.

As an instructor he wasn't terrible, just wasn't the best.  His tests and assignments were fairly easy but lectures were a little bit boring considering how he spend the entire hour talking about one subject.  His assignments aren't actually that related to the course or on the final.  He assigns them so he has something to use for his research.

If you are planning to take Ed. Psych at SFU, avoid Nesbit at all costs.  His lectures are a waste of time, he uses his unintelligible concept maps to explain things. His exams are all multiple choice but are so poorly written you will not be able to determine which answer he wants. Avoid him like the plague, I wish I had.
This guy sucks!! I hated this class. Boring.
His lectures are average, but it's pretty bland content. The g-study program he had us use was useless. Memorizing theorists and theories is 90% of the work.

Would u like to have a prof who: Regurgitates psyc 100/102 w/a splash of educational flavouring here & there? Forces u to own a computer by requiring the use of the useless 'gstudy' (when it works mind u) for assignments? Bores u to death w/talk about his latest Wikipedia discovery or submission?  If so, this prof is for you! TA's ROCKED tho BTW!

awesome teacher. He's very interested in what he teaches and the assignments are helpful for one pursuing a career in education. They allow oneself to explore the current issues in education by doing the think paper and strategy reflection.

Do not sign the permission form allowing him to use you for his research!  The projects in this class are all to support his research.  The assignments are otherwise pointless, and do not help you learn the content at all.  Nesbit's class is a waste of time, and designed to benefit only him, not teach his students.  Don't waste your time and effort
Horrible course.  Horrible prof.  Take it distance ed, not on campus.
Great professor. Very clear and fair.

Uses students as lab rats.  Totally stupid course.  Don't bother studying...I guessed and did almost as well as the girls with flash cards and tons of notes.  That said, it's not an easy class.  It's very time-consuming.  DO NOT TAKE IT!

I'm sort of on the fence about him.  Lectures not all that interesting, but not too too bad either when compared to some of the other profs I've had.  The course was reletively simple, but it did need quite a bit of memorization.  Overall, I might take another course with him again, but I wouldn't be too excited about it.

His lectures were well organized but I found his reliance on the website very frustrating as everytime the internet went down we were stranded in lecture.  Also the website he used for the class was very confusing.  The content was interesting, but the tests were quite difficult unless you memorized the whole text and every word of the lecture.

I didn't like that he made us do our papers on things that he could later use for his research.  I felt used!!  His midterms are really hard, because you have to memorize everything from the textbook, and he just reguritates the text book into his notes.  Monotone voice and felt my time wasn't utilized to it's full potential.

lectures are dry.  his test are tough as he expects you to memorize the smallest things from the textbook. for example, he will take a sentence and make a question out of it, so if you havent read the text you will not know what he is talking about.

Interesting content and engaging lectures. There's lots of opportunities to get help. Maybe a little too much technology incorporated and the tutorials could be way better. Lectures have a lot of current examples. The content is thick so its not a piece of cake but its a good class.

This prof treated the entire class like his own personal guinea pigs. One assignment was to use some computer program and rate its usefulness for his own research! I rarely went to class because he was soooo dry in lecture. AVOID.

This guy cracks me up! He can be funny (although maybe not intentionally). Has purpose to his lectures. Very clear on what he wants and very reasonable. Downside: can be too accomdating to the 'complainers' or 'keeners'.

I took this class because I wanted a classroom experience to help me better understand the subject. Turns out I should have just taken the distance ed version as the help and instruction were about the same. Practice what you teach, Nesbit!
this guy is not a good prof he just shouldnt be teaching. it is so hard to do well in this class also, even if you attend class all the time.

Really hard class, need to memorize the whole text book( including the stuff in brackets) to get an o.k. mark. His exams are brutal, assignments ridiculous. He goes against everything he teaches that you should do as a teacher. Take a different prof or distance ed!

DO NOT take this class or else  beprepared to work your a** off and still fail. He is a educ prof yet he does not apply any of teaching methods he teaches. Had to give everyone bonus marks because class average was too low. if exam ave is low all the time doesnt that show something about his exams?

Interesting that this teacher has a PhD about how people learn.  Hard, detailed exams, difficult assignments, and he did use one for his own research. However, if you put in alot of effort, time, and clarify info with your TA, Nesbit, and other students, you have a chance of doing well.
Don't take this class unless you want to be a lab rat and learn nothing.  Don't need to go to lectures or tutorials to pass.

I personally enjoy the material and the lectures aren't bad. The notes are a good guide to the textbook. Nesbit is fair and is very open to listening to students' concerns. I mean, he bumped the midterm avg up 10% and extended the assign deadline. His lecturing style could use more confidence though
knows his stuff

Terrible class. I'm a psyc major so this is 100 level psyc stuff. TOO MANY POINTLESS ASSIGNMENTS! Stupid concept maps and his notes contain no information. Tests way too hard (class did so bad, he had to add 5 marks to everyone). Tutorials pointless, don't do anything in them but be guinnea pigs.
Do it distance ed.  This education professor can't teach.  Pointless tutorials and lectures.  Tutorial time wasted being test subjects for him.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!  It is terrible!  He bases the content on his own research.  He even evaluates your exam results for his own research. DO NOT SIGN THE RESEARCH PERMISSION!  SPREAD THE WORD!!

A really nice man who seems to love the material.  Although the lectures are slightly dull, Nesbit starts to grow on you. You also have to give him credit because most of the research he alludes to is usually quite interesting.  He also seems to be fair and sympathetic.

He needs to go back to Tech BC! He spends about 1/3rd of the class talking about computers. He  made us learn this horrible concept map program and made it very clear that no tech support would be offered. Tutorials and lectures are beyond pointless. Don't pay him to waste your time, do distance ed!

NEVER EVER TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!!!!! Lectures were totally useless!!!!! TA's had attitudes and were not interested in helping. One of the TA's went over stuff in tutorials, the others did not. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH JOHN!!!!!!

Disclaimer: I'm bitter because I was 0.4% away from an A. Dr.Nesbit is a horrible teacher, but a very nice man. He and the TA's go out of their way to answer questions;however, the tutorials and lectures are somewhat useless.

Lectures were somewhat pointless.  A VERY thick and detailed textbook.  Very hard midterm, much better exam, all multiple choice.  Very nice and a considerate prof, very responsive to his student's comments / suggestions, but his ability to teach is not his strong point.

Uses tutorial time for own research.  Boring lectures but also too much information in text book.  Extremely hard midterm and final, ONLY multiple choice.  At least there are other assignments to boost grade. Nice guy though.

pointless lectures, exams were horrible and do not reflect class/lab material. Uses lab time for own research<---- what the heck is that! GPA dropper. 70 out of 120 pple failed the midterm. WOW. Try to avoid him. i heard this class was easy and fun, not with him.

Nice guy, but unreasonably difficult exams. You have to remember every single little detail from the textbook, which is impossible. Most of the tested material is stuff that's not covered or barely mentioned in the lectures.

Nesbit and his "Teaching Team" are beyond terrible. He uses tutorials for his own research not for student's learning. WORST CLASS EVER.His exams are so detailed that it would take a photographic memory and a miracle to do well. He needs to step away from his computer programs and get a clue!

Lecture's are terrible, extremely dull! The tutorials aren't bad... essentially, the material isn't taught well--all over the place... assignments are easy to do well on, the exams aren't that great... a waste! They're helpful though.
Boooooring class. Pointless to go to lecture. Tutorials have been a waste of time. Easy high B or A mark, but frustrating, when your time is so wasted
consider of his students and tries to accomadate ways to better help students. Interesting class.
Easy to understand, very clear lectures. He's thoughtful in his ideas and is very responsive to questions. Class is pretty slack.

Worst class I've ever taken. She went away the week our term paper was due, doesn't respond to questions properly, isn't very accessible, and doesn't teach properly. Our weekly discussion activities felt like assignments for a W course. Textbook readings were long and sometimes the info felt unnecessary. This class has overwhelmed me all semester.

Very disorganized/last minute. She held a Zoom meeting for any questions about an assignment, except she told us about it 2 days in advance, planned it on a Saturday, and time slots were 10 minutes. Rarely answers questions, and if she does she just refers you to the syllabus which contradicts Canvas. Lectures are just an audiobook of the textbook.

Easy/interesting course but disorganized. Put up a discussion board where you can ask questions, but checks it once every two weeks at best and hardly responds to emails. The assignments, readings, lectures, rubrics, are spread all over Canvas and you have to explore the page to find them. The due dates on Canvas don't match the syllabus either.

Ofelia is a very disorganized prof with no understanding of Canvas as a learning platform. Be prepared for assignments not to be uploaded onto the platform, unclear due dates, discrepancies between Canvas and the syllabus and for assignments to take forever to be graded. Expect to teach yourself from the textbook.

This class was terrible. The content is useful but she wasn't helpful at all. I found her always changing the syllabus which was very frustrating. She would throw random assignments at you with a few days before it was due. Always unclear of what she wanted. Never made anything clear for her Ta's as she told them not to attend lectures....

The marking is fair and easy compared to many other classes. We get opportunity to create a lesson plan and it is pretty helpful if u r interesting in teaching!Difinitely take this course!!U can also learn some study strategies in this class!

The exams are easy and fair compared to many other courses. There are lots of  extra materials for us to know and read. We get opportunity to create a lesson plan for children and that is pretty helpful. We also learn some study strategies which are extremely help the study for my other classes as well.

In my entire university career I have never come across such a compassionate and understanding professor. The course did fluctuate through the semester, but she made sure that all the changes were to the benefit of the students. She always went above and beyond when answering questions or concerns. Remarkable prof and a really interesting class.

Course was interesting and the content extremely valuable. I learned about how to learn and my study habits have improved dramatically. Her instructions for assignments are unclear and subject to frequent change (VERY frustrating), but her marking schemes are very fair; it's worth it if you can get past the confusion.
I love this prof!! makes content easy to understand and connects with students. Office hours are on zoom. my fave class that I look forward to. Def recommend it.

• Welcomes use of AI in the class — as long as you properly cite it.
• Speaks clearly and slowly, easy to follow the lectures.
• No tests in this course, but it is assignment/reflection heavy.

She's a fine professor and the class is overall pretty easy. Going to lectures is pointless (there's no exams based on the content). The assignments are easy but you do the same thing each time and it's really boring and repetitive - self reflection and connecting course concepts to your experience. It is not psychology, more like gender studies.

Robyn is super sweet, warm, kind, welcoming, helpful and accessible outside of class. Do the blogs in advance.I worked on them the day they were due but still got full marks! Work collaboratively in group work. When something is not clear ask the prof. she will make everything clear to you. TA was nice and had a lovely accent! AWESOME PROF AND TA!!

This class follows a notion entirely opposite to what you would assume Educational Psychology would be. Her class material is that of a Gender Studies class and just feels very lost. Her syllabus does not seem to have a general theme, nor end goal of learning,some discussions have also been controversial. I would not recommend this as an elective.

One of the best professors I've ever had. She is warm, kind, welcoming, and incredibly helpful. If you have the chance to take one of her classes-- do it! She is AWESOME!. To do well in her course, just do the blogs in advance, work collaboratively in group work, and just ask the prof if something is not clear towards your understanding.
One of the best professors I've ever had. She is warm, kind, welcoming, and incredibly helpful. If you have the chance to take one of her classes-- do it! She is AWESOME!

Robyn is so organized, caring, and overall lovely. She is a real gem! Though I do think in this particular course, you were more at the mercy of the TA than her. Luckily I had a good one. My only complaint is that there was very little interaction in a class that big, I would have loved to interact with her more!

I love her so much!! She really cares about her students and the lectures are very interesting and amazing!! Also, she is very good at explaining some key terms by using different examples. The TA are very nice too!! If you see her name, just choose her! But the worst part I would say is the SFU Education grading scale, which is not her fault.

She wasnt a bad prof, she seemed very passionate about her course and was very understanding in terms of accommodations. I wish the grade was not so heavily dependent on the final essay though, because there was a final and midterm too. I kept getting mixed responses for my essay feedback so the essay was a challenge.

Robyn has an exceptional ability to teach and really cares about her students. It's clear that she puts effort into designing her lecture slides, regularly communicating with her students, and ensuring that we are learning and connecting the material to our lives outside of class. This is an enjoyable course and not too difficult if you keep up.

Robyn is great! She models the teaching behaviours you learn in the class. Super clear instructions, great with communicating ideas and concepts. Fairly easy exams and assignments. My one complaint is that she changed the readings multiple times, but it was always to reduce the workload, so not bad at all. I would highly recommend her!

Jeff's lectures are interesting and his exams are all multiple choice. You need to know the textbook and readings to do well. The format of his first paper was a bit confusing, but still very easy course with a good TA. Good idea to take notes in class as the slides that he posts are very brief.

Exams are very fair and easy if you study his slides as he also states in class. The 2 assignments are kinda awkward, the instructions and formats of how they're supposed to be written aren't that clear or specified so there's a lot of grey area for you to lose marks in. He tries to make the class interesting but overall he's pretty good.

Lectures weren't necessary to go to. I just read the textbook and was good to go. Assignments and final exam were pretty straight forward and easy depending on your TA. Would take another course from Jeff!
Lectures were interesting. Midterm and final were straightforward; however, the thinking papers can be quite difficult for those who are not familiar with writing these kinds of papers.

This is a VERY hard course. you are expected to memorize nearly everything in the textbook. The course is very heavy!! Way exceeding the 3 unit credit. You basically don't have to attend classes, just stay at home and memorize the book
Wonderful, dynamic, passionate professor. Think paper's were hard and time consuming. there are 2 of them! great guy. great teacher!
Compassionate about the course, but midterms and final is too hard. His TA's were brutal, EXTREMELY hard markers. Avoid him if you can.

2 papers, 1 midterm and 1 final. midterm and finals are easy all MC. 2 papers' marks depend on the TA. The first one I screwed up. But i did pretty well on the second one. Textbook is helpful for extra infos, but mainly study his notes will ace you through the exams. recommend teacher, tho i zoomed out some time in his class.

Two papers are worth 40% of your grade, and it literally depends on your TA. My TA gave me 70% on my papers when I've been getting consistent A's in my 400 level courses. The average on the exams are near 60%-65%. A+s are not common as no one ever got a perfect mark on the exams.

great prof. he knows what he is talking about and he expect you to too. great lectures. can't miss one class coz the midterms and finals are based mainly on class notes. quite heavy work load: 2 papers (non research 6 pages think paper) , 1 midterm, 1 final
Wonderful teacher! Obviously if you dont come to class or pay attention you wont do well but he was very engaging and really made his points clear. Definitely would take another one of his courses.

He is an amazing lecturer.  His multiple choice tests were very fair.  The people who complain about them likely didn't study, as most of the class assumed the tests were going to be very easy.  He made the material very applicable and interesting.  Somehow managed to time every lecture perfectly for the hour we had, which I appreciate!!

I just loved Sugarman! He was interesting, clearly passionate about education and psychology, and very helpful during office hours. His exams were fair if you attended class and did the readings, and I actually enjoyed writing the essays in his class. Plus, he's pretty attractive!

B-O-R-I-N-G! LOVE the textbook. That's all the class has going for it. All theory, no application. He teaches that multiple choice tests are a poor testing method. All his tests are multiple choice. "Teach as I say and not as I do." The class has so much potential to be great, the material is there, but he doesn't tap in. It's really too bad.

Reads in monotone from his notes on the overhead (I could do that).  Dry, dry, dry.  Everything is online.  Save yourself the gas and listen to the lecture tapes in the library.  More ironic is the use of multiple choice questions on both exams - didn't we learn that they're unreliable?  Easy to mark, though.  Little imagination in this course.

He's okay.  Not the most inspiring prof, but I wouldn't avoid taking a course with him.  His marking scheme is a little tougher than standard, but if you put in the effort you can achieve a good grade.

One of the best prof's ive had. He's very interested in the subject matter and it reflects in his teaching style. The class is relatively easy if you put in some effort. The exams are easier than the papers

AWESOME PROF!!!  He makes it really easy to get a good grade, and treats students with respect.  He doesn't dumb things down, and his advice is based solidly in experience.  Highly recommend his course!!!

A nice guy but I was disappointed with the course. Its more of a first year psych course than anything that belongs in the Education field! It's a lot of review if you've taken Psych & Sugarman doesn't add much to the course. He is friendly, but doesn't try to make the course any fun. Exams are heavily weighted & hard. Probably better to avoid him!
Hard marking scheme but lectures are interesting and fun

Sugarman Sugarman what can I say?  His marking system is defintely akward but his lecture is too hilarious.  He makes lectures unboring and fun and is very helpful when you need help.  I would recommend people to take this course but you have to be committed and interested or else you'll fall behind pretty fast.
Very organized and prepared for class.  Charismatic, engaging speaker.  I have rather strong views about some of the material, but no problems with him as a prof.
Really funny.  Great lecturer.  Provides notes and has tons of anecdotes to share that makes the material meaningful and interesting.
very helpful and genuine!

VERY insightful and extremely fair. Course is not graded on a curve so what you get is actually what you get. He also adds little experiments related to each letter to keep everyone engaged... not saying that he has to.

One of the best public speakers that you'll have the chance to hear at SFU. His lectures are enjoyable - insightful and inspiring for students aspiring to become teachers (a great role model!). He has a lot of experience in this field. Would not mind taking 5 courses with this prof! Highly recommended class and prof! Best of luck to you all!
Great teacher with a sense of humour.

His lectures are insightful and interesting, and he created the class, so his intelligence on the subject is extreamly relevant. However, he was rarely availible for extra help, most of your mark is based on m/c and he discourages questions in his class. Interesting class, mediocre prof.
Fantastic prof, interesting lectures. He's a very good teacher and makes the material easy to learn. A+'s were common.
very charismatic man, very interesting and easy course.  I highly recommend it.

his lectures very boring. His notes regurgitated from text, and essay was not a "think paper". His grading system was COMPLETELY different from other educ. and dept., all exams m/c, so if you suck at them, you will do poorly in this class.

organized lectures but kind of boring unless you're really interested in educ psyc. he posts his notes up on the web so you don't have to go all the time. exams are m/c q's & you only need to study off his notes for that.
Very organized and easy going prof.  Lectures are fun, not boring at all !
Nice prof, notes are organized. His test focuses mainly on lecture and lecture notes.
Fair professor.  Tried very hard to make the course easy to understand for his students. He obviously enjoys teaching. A bit boring sometimes, but everyone in my class liked him.  Very fair on tests.
Great lecturer,easy to listen to and knows how to make information relevant. Easily one of the best.
really nice and funny teacher.  good clear lectures, however his marker system is different from other teachers. to get an A in his course you need 92%.

his exams are relatively easy compare to any other courses. his exams are mainly focused on lecture. so you have to be prepared to write down everything he said in lecture. coz' some questions can be lint picking of what he said...
VERY intelligent professor! Organized, witty, and has an exceptional ability to pull out a quote for every occassion. Encouraged discussion and made info interesting. HIGHLY RECOMENDED!

Jeff communicates his material really well although he does tend to talk too fast.  The think paper topics are too broad and should be narrowed down.  His exams are fair although they're not as easy as he makes them sound.  Work hard and you'll do fine.

Great professor. Knows his material well and organizes his lectures well. The exams are multiple choice but the questions could be considered to be pretty difficult and the weighting is 1 question=1%.

Jeff is easily one of the best profs I have ever had.  Knows the material very well and explains it so it's easy to understand.  Helpful that he posts the lecture notes prior to lecture so you can listen without having to worry about writing everything!
If you are in biology, you will understand when I say this prof. is one of the best profs there is.
Jeff is an interesting professor. The midterm was not as "easy" as he said it was. And he is not hot!
very clear lectures. not one of those who prides himself on failing students.  always eager to help students, and cute too.
One of the best professors I've ever had, he really wants his students to learn and so he tires to make it fun for them.
one of the best profs I've had..passionate, enthusiastic, fun prof! :)
funny, interesting prof who makes the material fun & accessible; very caring & enthusiastic re: education
well, i think he's hot at his age! =) one of the best profs i've ever had
Always get my attention during his lecture!
average...that's all
GREAT, GREAT PROF!
No Comments
he's da BESTest prof i ever had! excellent lectures too!!
Great prof. Entertaining, funny and educational.
Very well organized, lectures are easy to follow, best prof I ever had
if all professors are like him, then every class will be fun and interesting..!
excellent prof, but a bad TA
No Comments
excellent prof..!!  every single lecture is intereting and valuable..!
Best prof ever!!!
He's the best prof... if you see a class he's teaching take it
excellent prof, very clear and interesting.  he knows what he's talking about..!
very good prof.  his lectures are very interesting.
No Comments
No Comments
he is the most amazing brilliant proff ever!!! i love him & wish he never left!!!!

Taking this DE. Being a psych major almost everything in this course has been taught to me already :) online discussions are a little unclear & not your typical set-up, but still manageable. Minimal work required & the course requirements are pretty split up so it's easy to do well!
Sola is such a great professor. He respects his students a lot and knows his stuff inside out. The feedback he provided on assignments were very useful.

TM for on-line Educ 220; completely non-existant.  Rarely responded to academic questions or provided feedback.  Couldn't substantiate his critiques for marking essays.  Hung up on concept maps, but never provided direction.  Didn't even show up for the final and left it all up to the other TM who did all the work thru-out the whole course.

I really don't know how others feel but you cannot have a more humble professor than Sola. He knows his stuff inside out and cares so much about his student. He was always there for us seeking ways to help us and reassuring us that his goal is to help us excel in his course. He is easy-going and has great teaching techniques and engages his class.
In his lecture, he sounded like he's the only one who knows the material.
Wasn't sure about him at first because he's a Ph.D candidate, not a full prof. To my surprise, he wasn't so bad and gave great feedback.

I finished the class with 97% total and received an A-. This was because she selectively went back to remark peoples work to intentionally lower marks because they were too high. I emailed her asking about this and she offered to write a letter of recommendation in return. Terrible. Save yourself the money and stress by avoiding her classes.
she is rude and gives ambiguous feedback to students. Always changing the syllabus and the course is really useless.

This was an utterly useless course.  GPA booster, but I would rather receive a lower mark and actually LEARN something.  Unwilling to consider others' views. Course is prereq for upper level, take w/ someone who will TEACH you. E-mail help = useless.  Unapproachable. Treats you like a child. Unclear. Ignores syllabus completely. Take diff prof.

The most useful course I have had in psyc. Alissa taught us new, unconventional learning strategies that helped anyone who was paying attention greatly. There needs to be more classes like this. She told us of her dyslexia the first class, so be prepared for some disorganization. Deal with it - she is a brilliant prof and marks easily and fair.

Alissa was rude, condescending, and talked down to students. The class was extremely disorganized. She gave multiple versions of vague instructions for the same assignment. Due dates and marks break downs constantly changed. Email communication initially good, stopped replying after the first month, but were never helpful anyway.

This class was super all over the place. She took over the TA's jobs, total micro-manager. Communication to TA's and students very poor! Syllabus changed every eye blink. Near the end of the term she started saying things like you guys survived this underdeveloped class good job ONLY near the end did she mention it. Excuses. bad :( not happy!
The most terrible and disorganized class I have ever taken anywhere.

Very disorganized. Provided a syllabus during the first class, and did not follow it at all throughout the semester. Creates unclear assignments last minute, and changes the grade distributions almost weekly. Rude, and unapproachable. Makes assumptions and calls students out during class because of it. Absolutely do not recommend her.

She is pretty disorganized but her assignments are easy (can be confusing to understand in the beginning). This course is definitely a GPA booster but her disorganization is an annoyance. Alissa is pretty flexible in terms of handing in assignments. She responds to emails relatively quick. Take with another prof if interested in this class.

SO DISORGANIZED! Super frustrating and annoying. Yes she replies emails but she replies in a way you feel put down. And makes things even more unclear than they were in the first place. Tiniest assignments requires so much time and effort. Springs things on last second. And extends things for people who didn't hand things in on time. FRUSTRATING!!

tough class to rate - on the one hand, definite GPA booster - on the other hand, regular really big annoyance.  her assignments are easy enough once you understand once you have to do.  she changed the syllabus last minute several times, throwing a last minute presentation at us in the last week of class (pretty easy, but still).

I like that she responds to e-mails quickly, but her feedback is not clear, and neither are her assignments. She says she understands that we have other classes, yet she assigns LOADS of readings and asks way too much of her students. I was interested in Educational Psyc before this class, but not anymore.

All over the place with deadlines and requirements, and uses a different website instead of WEBCT which is hard to follow. She expects a lot from you; article to read, online forum to post discussion to, attendance mandatory tutorials, readings, and questions EVERY week. Super interesting course though, and she's responds to emails.

Best professor I've had at SFU. Not only is Dr. Marzouk an incredibe lecturer and teacher, she is unbelievably kind and caring. I had some personal issues come up towards the end of the semester, and Dr. Marzouk made all the difference. She was encouraging, understanding and her passion for the material is infectious.

Zahia is an amazing prof. She really cares for her students and always tries to be extra enthusiastic over Zoom to engage students. She communicates concepts clearly and provides multiple examples to make sure students understand. She didn't mark any of our work, the TA's did, so I can't comment on that. I highly recommend taking a class with her!

She was very kind and funny, she made lectures enjoyable to come too on zoom. She wanted all her students to succeed on tests and assignments. She was clear with instructions and I would definitely take another class with her in the future. she's super passionate about what she does.
Shes embodies what being a teacher truly means

She is so caring! Lectures are very helpful as they go over content from the readings, but the exams are definitely textbook-based. She also keeps students engaged and gets to know you if she can. Amazing prof over-all.

Zahia really cares for her students. At first, I thought the material was a lot in my class but if you attend the lectures, you are able to pick on on everything! The only thing, sometimes you need to clarify with her about assignments but other than that, I'm so glad she was one of the first teachers I had at SFU. Highly recommend!

shes super nice. she always has a lot of energy and lectures are really entertaining but u do need to come to class because the slides she uploads have little info and she talks in depth in class and the textbook corresponds to the notes so its not a huge neccesity to get. tests are very fair and her ta's are super helpful!

Zahia's teaching was SO unorganized that it made this course difficult. The criteria for all the assignments were extremely unclear and she kept changing little details about the assignments without communicating with the TA's so there was a lot of confusion and miscommunication in my class. Also she was NOT accessible.

Extremely passionate about her subject, wants students to succeed! Gives out criteria for papers too close to the deadline, will change criteria in class but not on website. I hardly went to class because the textbook is the same as the lectures. Tutorial presentation project is easy if you do the work. Tests are easy, no surprises, all MC.
She cares about her students, and her tests are easy as long as you study! very nice and approachable, clear and organized.

She really wants everyone to succeed in her course and tries to engage with a big class during lecture. Exams are fair but assignments might need some clarification. She is so sweet - blew us a kiss on the last day of class!

Zahia is one of the most passionate people I've ever met! She really cares about her students, and makes sure that we understand the material. I highly recommend that you go to the lectures, because the slides wont make sense otherwise. But if you dont feel like going to the lectures, the content is the exact same in the textbook, so you'll be fine

Most underrated prof, Zahia is amazing. She takes boring, dry material, & adds so much experience and examples to it that it can't help but get stuck in your brain. She really cares about the learning of her students. Her slides won't make sense if you don't attend lecture, & she doesn't record them so it's a good idea to attend. She's hilarious.

you can skip the lectures but if you skip the tutorials your presentation mark will decrease by 2 points. she is an okay prof who really cares but treats the lecture as if there were 20 of us instead of 400. Good teacher but needs to realize people do not want to participate in a large lecture.
excellent

The lectures were absolutely useless, they came straight from the textbook, even her examples. She barely seemed to understand what she was teaching - a student could have done a better job. Ironically, she's teaching students how to teach... well, here's a tip - don't take any lessons from her!!!

Lisa is a terrible lecturer. She uses the word "um" a lot and cannot go one sentence without saying it. Her resume is very good but when it comes to teaching, she doesnt sound like she knows what she's talking about and makes you wonder how she even went to a high end university.
Nice guy. Knew his stuff. Always available.

As said, HELPFUL! Seems to know about every topic we studied. After many classes I would chat with him about the topic, he's give me the names of people in the area of research, and not just the names from the textbook. Funny and engaging. I sat next to a football player who told me it was the only class he and the other players attended regularly

Great Professor. Genuinely cares about his students and the subject. Very clear. Responds to e-mails immediately. Funny, smart and engagins. Had many problems with the TA for this class, but Rob is fantastic and I would recommend him to anyone.
Awesome prof. Funny, helpful, and very relatable. The assignment load was average, lots of reading, but VERY valuable/interesting. I'd recommend this ourselves, was my favorite.

Great professor. Engaging, compassionate, caring and has a great personality. Never had a single problem. Do not trust the other comments on here, they may have had a bad experience with a TA which is in no way reflective of Rob. Would definitely recommend ANY class with him.
he is so sweet and nice! and a very reasonable dude.one of my best in the past 3 years at sfu. i think it is some what of a GPA booster if you actually read the textbook. totally related to psyc100.

SUCH a nice guy. He genuinely cares about his students, the course, and his TA's and that is very refreshing to see as many professors do not. The course in general is pretty good, I'd prefer a different textbook with chapters that aren't as long, but it's not so bad. Keep up with your readings!!! And if you need anything, let him know :)

Not sure what that other reviewer was saying about the TA - rate the TA, not Dr. McT! Funny guy, was available 24/7, I would send a question and have a response back within minutes, even at 4 AM!! Said to drop by his office for any help with any course after the semester was over, I truly believe he meant it. He cares about more than just his class
Rob is awesome! He's a really interesting guy and tells lots of stories, his own is really inspirational. Friendliest prof you'll ever have and really loves the subject :)

Nice guy but the class itself was quite disorganized.Having 50 minute lecture is a waste of travel time because you didn't get much done. Discussion was not encouraged. Tutorial is mandatory but the TA didn't take attendance or know my name by semester end so not sure how that works. Hand-outs and syllabus differed. I would do distance ed course
Approachable, Accommodating, Available = Awesome! Heâ??s Mr. Friendly :-)
Fun, interesting guy. Approachable, very approachable. Friendly, accommodating. Passionate. Caring.

Funny, helpful, eager to help. Always available. Lost control of the class once, but it wasn't really his fault, it was the last class and people were all talking at the back.One student got frustrated at the noise and interrupted the lecture to tell people to shut up.

Fun Class, took it for a second time to improve my mark, very different with Rob. I wanted to come to class! Funny stories. Helped me with course/career guidance after class, really took the time to connect with me. Thank you!
Funny, lots of stories, lots of personal experiences that relate. Easy to follow and fun to listen to.
Funny guy. Passionate about teaching and education.

He was interested in certain students comments and completely uninterested in others. oh well. he's human and liable to be a bit of a meanie. otherwise, very thought provoking class. i really enjoyed the course material.

Designing prof for on-line Educ 220, but didn't interact outside the initial intros.  The entire class was run by 2 TMs; one of which was almost non-existant.  No guidance or support with respect to mid-term or final.  M/C questions were very random.  Short answer were picky.  Essays included stupid concept maps. Online discussions were redundant

I'm not sure why all the terrible feedback, I thought she was ok.  I went to see her for help a few times and she was very willing to help.  Attending class and reading the text is a must in order to understand the material.  There is no floating through this class.  If you put in work it will pay off as it did for me.

Horrible.  Plain and simple.  She looks to belittle students and seems to enjoy destroying the comments and assistance requests from the students whose fees employ her.  She is truly a horrible, unhappy and mean spirited lady.  Absolutely discusting!!!
awful prof. always late. i was interested in the material before i had her as  teacher. avoid at all costs. the course itself is easy.
Horrible prof. Rude and impersonal. talks in circles. Looks organized but is afraid to admit she makes mistakes. Run while you can.
Awsome teacher, don't take this class if you are one of those stupid people who doesn't like to put in effort. Knows her material very well, would definatly take a class with her again

I dont know what the fuss is about. I'm an average student.. and I did well She is a very organized prof, who's lecture might be dry, but she gives great notes, which you can download ahead of time, and then during lecture she gives tons of examples...exams were not bad, as long as u study text the text and notes. No surprises.
She was ok.  However, her lectures were dry and sterile.
Meh.
Rod was a great TA and teacher. Thank you for your help.
Distance Ed course. Very helpful & quick to respond to ?'s. Tests are extremely hard, but assignments are easy. Great prof!
What can I say... She's better than those TA whom you see every week. You wouldn't believe that it's only a distance edu. course... SHE'S GREAT!

I really enjoyed Dr. Chang's class. Assignments and discussions were clear, and you could do well by following the guidelines. He also gave us bonus marks for uploading our notes, and we could earn an extra 1% by checking each other's work. He was also supportive and gave us an extension since feedback from the previous assignment was delayed.
I actually took EDUC222 (not listed above). This was my second class with Daniel. He is nice, funny and helpful.
he is one of the kindest profs ive ever had. so genuine but his lectures can be pretty boring

I took Daniel for EDUC Psych 220, and I experienced a bad car accident 1/4 into the semester. I shared this with Daniel and he was extremely understanding and accommodating of my situation. He worked with me to help me complete the semester given my restrictions due to my injuries. I am very grateful for all of his support. Highly recommend him!

I've taken two classes with Daniel Chang so far, both online and they were super easy. You just have to do every assignment and you're pretty much guaranteed an A. He really seems to want his students to succeed and the content is very straightforward while also being engaging and useful.
Daniel is very caring and responds to emails/questions quickly and with detail. His assignments, midterm and final are all graded fairly. The course overall was straightforward.

He was my TA before and I just found out he becomes a professor! He is very nice and caring. You can feel that he really cares about his students. Not a tough grader, gives good feedback, makes good jokes, S tier professor.

I've had Daniel for both EDUC220 and EDUC326, and he was great for both. Replies to emails very quickly and throughout all hours of the day/night. He puts a lot of effort into his teaching, and there are opportunities for extra credit in 220 if you take good notes. Lots of reading, but would recommend him!

Very accessible outside of class, replying emails with lighting speed (immediately most of the time)! He is very caring and listening to students' opinions. I met him in person for reviewing midterm exam and he was very friendly. Class assignments and discussions aren't that bad. Exams can be tough because there are a lot of long readings!
Dr Chang was extremely supportive of his students, you can tell he wants everyone to succeed. The course itself can be difficult but he does his best to be supportive.

I found EDUC220 fairly hard and there was tons of reading to complete, but Dr. Chang is an excellent instructor. His mini lectures are very helpful and he replies to emails very quickly. The assignments, discussions, and learning activities are well constructed and helpful for reinforcing ideas from the textbook.

Sweetest prof ever! He really wants his students to succeed in the course and gives out bonus marks. Assignments are very original and gets you thinking about the lecture materials. Very understanding with students tries his best to provide as much details as possible with clear instructions. Quick replier to emails.

You can really tell that Daniel cares about his students. He's always accessible outside of class, gives clear and concise instructions and really varies the type of assignments that are done (which makes them more interesting IMO). He really sets the class up well and is super nice! I would take any class with him again

Daniel is incredibly kind and recognizes the different strengths students have. Gives opportunities for students to do well and cares that students do well. Is supportive, available, and values and implements decolonization in their approach to teaching. Hated the text book but Daniel made up for it!

Not a GPA booster course. He is very responsive to emails and I often got his emails back within just a minute or two even during weekends. The quizzes are pretty difficult but you can take them twice. The second time I took the quizzes often got higher marks. Make sure you study the textbook and complete the writing assignments.

Daniel is a great person. He has helped me a couple of times with my writing assignments when he worked for the writing centre, however, this is the first time I have taken a class with him. I honestly did not enjoy it much, there is many reading and writing to do, I feel this should be a W class (5 essays 750 words-ish each, plus discussion posts)
